title: Greta Thunberg's mum is a famous Swedish opera singer who competed in Eurovision
text:

Teenage climate change activist Greta Thunberg has become world-famous.

She is a climate crusader, spearheading campaigns and protests for worldwide environmental change.

The teenager is now a global icon after she led the ‘School Strike for the Climate’ movement and made a fiery address to world leaders at the 2019 UN Climate Action Summit in September.

However, Greta is no stranger to the spotlight as she comes from a remarkable Swedish family with links to fame.

(Image: Eurovision TV)

Her mother Malena Ernman is a Swedish opera singer and one of the country's best-known mezzo-sopranos.

In 2009, she made her Eurovision debut in Moscow, Russia, and performed one of the catchiest Europop hits of the decade 'La Voix'.

A Youtube video of Malena's performance has more than two million views and shows the singer belting out the number and parading around the stage in a dramatic white gown complete with statement feathers.

Despite singing her heart out, Greta's mum became Sweden's second lowest placed Eurovision entry - at 21 but had some success in the Swedish music charts.

(Image: Eurovision TV)

Global superstars ABBA launched their pop careers after winning Eurovision for Sweden back in 1974.

There’s also a musical link with Greta's father Svante as he played a classical composer in a TV series in 2002.

Svante has also been noted for his role in the series Skargardsdoktorn which ran from 1997 to 2000.

The teens grandfather Olof Thunberg was also a well-known actor and in February, Greta spoke to the The New York Times about her early exposure to fame.

(Image: Eurovision TV)

(Image: Eurovision TV)

She said: "That’s one of the pros of having a famous mother … I’m quite familiar with the media and how it works."

Greta's passionate attitude towards climate change reportedly impacted her parents so much so that Malena also stopped travelling in airplanes and halted her singing career.

However, Greta's sister Beata is following in their mother's footsteps and has taken up singing and dancing.

(Image: Getty Images)

News of Malena's singing success comes after Greta, who travelled to the US by yacht to avoid flying, gave Donald Trump a withering death stare after her speech in New York.

Addressing the crowd, the activist said: "This is all wrong. I shouldn't be up here.

"I should be back in school on the other side of the ocean yet you all come to us young people for hope. How dare you.

"You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words."

Greta was recently named as one of the 100 most influential people of 2019 by Time magazine and has been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize . The winner will be revealed on October 11.
description: The 16-year-old climate change activist comes from a famous family with a renowned opera singer mother and an actor father
